data.title: J.J. Thomson – Documentary
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Physics 1906 was awarded to Joseph John Thomson "in recognition of the great merits of his theoretical and experimental investigations on the conduction of electricity by gases"
data.text:
J.J. Thomson

Documentary

Your browser does not support the video tag.

Sir Joseph J. Thomson talks about electrical engineering and his thoughts about the discovery of the electron. The film was made on 18 October 1934 by the Institution of Electrical Engineers.
